google_play_reviews.content: use it,,,,
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I am glad you like Discreet Launcher!

google_play_reviews.content: Other than the lack of ability to add widget, everything is just all i wanted in a launcher
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review, I am glad you like Discreet Launcher! Indeed, widgets support is not planned as it requires additional permissions and moves away from the idea of having a distraction-free home screen.

google_play_reviews.content: I experience? The missing of this launcher are application at the home screen, Phone call, Contact app Drawer.message Browser.. this must display to the lowered portion of Android Screen.. any way this only suggestion.. to be good..
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your suggestions. As stated in the description, the purpose of this launcher is to have an empty home screen (but you can add frequently used apps to the favorite panel). Handling phone calls, contacts and messages are the purpose of other apps that my launcher doesn't aim to replace.

google_play_reviews.content: Well this app lacks basic functionality that I need in a launcher. For example I spent 5 minutes trying to put an icon on my home screen. I finally just gave up and tried to uninstall it and the uninstall button is greyed out, so I'm gonna have to use adb cmds to get rid of it. What a hassle? Maybe the playstore will let me uninstall it there, gonna see. Yeah the playstore let me uninstall it.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hello, when a launcher is the default launcher, its uninstall button is grayed by the Android system. To uninstall, you can select another default launcher or use the Play Store as bypass (like you did). As stated in the description, the purpose of this launcher is to have an empty home screen (with a favorite panel for frequently used apps).

google_play_reviews.content: It is the best launcher in the world but add Google slides bar on the left
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review! However I don't plan to add the Google feed as removing it (and the Google search bar) was one of the reasons which led me to create this launcher in the first place.

google_play_reviews.content: Pretty great,clean and minimal
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review!

google_play_reviews.content: No way to use a clock widget.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Indeed, widgets are not supported. However there is an embedded clock with various customization settings (see the "Clock" section in "Appearance" settings).

google_play_reviews.content: This is really one of the best simple and minimal launcher I've ever seen. You could create folders for your apps and easily access your favourite apps....great features It's four stars out of five cos it doesn't have its own wallpapers? If it does, I couldn't find them...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review, I am glad you like Discreet Launcher! Changing the wallpaper is indeed not included because it would require the read storage permission, and most gallery apps already provide this feature in a more convenient way (option "Set as" when viewing a picture).

google_play_reviews.content: It's similar but better than hg launcher.but your hidden app features is not password protected.so anyone can acess hidden app.hg launcher also has this fault.plz correct this in next update.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thank you for your review! The Hidden apps feature is intended to hide bloatware apps that cannot be disabled, not to protect apps (a launcher cannot really protect apps anyway, as someone could always use the default launcher to access any app).

google_play_reviews.content: I like it!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you!

google_play_reviews.content: How to hide apps
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much for your review! You can hide apps by opening the main menu (engine key or Discreet Launcher icon) going to the entry "Hidden apps" and selecting the ones you want to hide. Same process to un-hide (the hidden apps will appear on top of the list). Best regards

google_play_reviews.content: Unique, lightweight and cleanest launcher , I have ever seen for Android.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much for your review, I am glad you like Discreet Launcher!

google_play_reviews.content: App is Excellent, wonderful, Thank you Sir
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much for your review, I am glad you like Discreet Launcher!

google_play_reviews.content: Good
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review!

google_play_reviews.content: Great launcher to show off your wallpaper. Great work by the Devs. Would love to see an option for double tap to turn screen off & a weather widget.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much for your review! Turning the screen off needs an admin permission that I don't want the launcher to request. But you can set double-tap to launch any app, so if you find an app that can turn off the screen it may work. Widgets support is not planned and, as the launcher is offline, an internal widget could not be updated, sorry.

google_play_reviews.content: Could use some animation.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review! I decided to not use animations to make the navigation in the launcher faster.

google_play_reviews.content: Launcher consuming less memory but draining battery is too high almost 50% within 8hrs. Sometimes it does not respond.19th Oct 2022 I regret for my earlier comments on battery consumption. It was my wrong observation. Sorry. Nice app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the report, however it seems very unlikely that my app consumes so much battery. On all the phones were I tested it the battery usage was below 1%. Are you sure this doesn't come from something else? (most of the time I observed battery drain on my phone it was related to mobile network, this can be checked in battery stats)
